required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Immediate Versus Delayed Removal of Urinary Catheter Following Elective Cesarean Section

oversight_info.authority: Egypt: Ministry of Health and Population

brief_summary.textblock: The objective this trial is to compare immediate and 12 hours postoperative removal of urinary catheter after elective cesarean section; and whether early removal is associated with lower risk of urinary infection compared with delayed catheter removal.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional

primary_outcome.measure: Number of cases with significant bacteriuria and urinary symptoms

arm_group.description: The catheter was removed immediately after the CS
The catheter was removed 12 hours postoperatively

study_pop.textblock: Women admitted to the prenatal wards for primary or repeat elective cesarean section

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women admitted to the prenatal wards for primary or repeat elective cesarean section
Exclusion Criteria:
- urinary infection (assessed clinically and by midstream urinalysis),
- significant vaginal bleeding,
- severe pre-eclampsia or eclampsia and/or any other conditions requiring postoperative monitoring of urinary output, and
- contraindications for general anesthesia.

facility.name: Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology, Faculty of Medicine, Cairo University
